table.name: updated_assignments
table.column:
• Read two of our initial documents: Info & Expectations and Supplies & Materials.

  • Get your supplies!

  • Write your math autobiography, discussing the outstanding highlights and lowlights of your math education. You will probably want to concentrate on the last couple of years, but you should go back as far as you remember. Tell me (with specific examples) your biggest strength and biggest weakness in math; explain what makes the former a strength and what you think you can do to compensate for your weakness. If you have not been in the Weston Public Schools all along, be sure to explain what schools you went to and when. In all cases, describe your math experiences in previous grades. Tell me what works for you in math, and what doesn't work. For example, is practice effective for you? Extra help from the teacher? Working with classmates? In all your previous schooling, what was your best year in math? Your worst? Why?

    This needs to be at least one substantial paragraph, but will probably take two or three paragraphs. As a minimum, I suggest 150-200 words. Send it to me (DavidsonL@weston.org) in an email message. Use math autobiography as your subject. If you have a mysterious email address, like superman42@comcast.net, be sure that your real name appears somewhere!

table.name: updated_assignments
table.column:
• Read two more of our initial documents: Homework and Classwork and Tests and Quizzes.
  • Remember to get your supplies!
  • Complete the Algebra Preparedness Sheet.

table.name: updated_assignments
table.column:
• Read the next two documents: Homework & Classwork and Tests & Quizzes.
  • Complete at least problems #1–11 in the Linear Functions Review, which you worked on in class.

table.name: updated_assignments
table.column:
• Read two more documents: Homework & Classwork and Tests & Quizzes.
  • Get all your supplies!
  • Complete Introductory Problems: New Ideas on Ratios, which you started in class.

table.name: updated_assignments
table.column: Read Chapter 3 in the textbook, or complete pages 6 & 7 of the Canegie-Mellon online Probability & Statistics course, linked on the course resources page at old.westonmath.org. Do the problems on the handout, "AP Statistics assignment 3."

table.name: updated_assignments
table.column: Read Chapter 2 in the textbook, or complete pages 10, 11 & 12 of the Canegie-Mellon online Probability & Statistics course, linked on the course resources page at old.westonmath.org. Then do the problems on "AP Statistics assignment 2."

table.name: updated_assignments
table.column: Read Chapters 1 and 2 in the textbook, or complete pages 13 through 18 of the Canegie-Mellon online Probability & Statistics course, linked on the course resources page at old.westonmath.org. Then do the problems on the handout "AP Statistics assignment 1."
